title: About
text:
Anton H. Westveld

I am a senior lecturer (Australian system) in the Research School of Finance, Actuarial Studies & Statistics at the Australian National University and an affiliate associate professor in the Department of Statistical Sciences and Operations Research at Virginia Commonwealth University.

Curriculum Vitae (follow embedded links to research articles)

I received my Ph.D. from the Department of Statistics at the University of Washington in Seattle where I was also a member of the Center for Statistics and the Social Sciences. My research interests include Bayesian methodology and theory, network and relational data, game theoretic data, inference (uncertainty quantification) for agent based stochastic computer simulation models, and statistical causality.

title: ASA DataFest 2023 @ The Australian National University
text: ANU through the Research School of Finance, Actuarial Studies and Statistics (virtually) ran DataFest 2022 competition from March 31 - April 2. See the ANU-RSFAS DataFest site for information.

title: Swen Kuh is a Winner of the Social Statistics Section Inaugural Poster Competition - JSM 2018
text: We were recently informed that Ms. Kuh was one of two winners of the inaugural poster competition held by the Social Statistics Section of the American Statistical Association - Joint Statistics Meeting 2018 held in Vancouver B.C.

title: ANU RSSS (with RSFAS) Cross College Grant to Study Networks within the Australian Political Landscape
text: In colloboration with Drs. Grace Chiu (RSFAS) and Shawn Trieier (RSSS), we received funding from the Research School of School Sciences in conjunction with the Research School of Finance, Actuarial Studies and Statistics (<http://rsss.cass.anu.edu.au/research/cross-college-grant>) for evidence-based statistical inference of network relations based on case studies from the Australian political landscape.

title: ASA DataFest 2022 @ The Australian National University
text: ANU through the Research School of Finance, Actuarial Studies and Statistics (virtually) ran DataFest 2022 competition from April 1- April 3. During the 48-hour friendly competition, five teams consisting of a total of 15 participants wrangled with and analysed a complex data set. See the ANU-RSFAS DataFest site for information.

title: Swen Kuh Received the IBISWorld Ph.D. Scholarship
text: At the ANU CBE Annual Prizes and Scholarships Ceremony 2016, Ms. Swen Kuh received her scholarship award from IBISWorld. This scholarship is funded from the grant received by Dr. Grace Chiu and Dr. Anton Westveld donated by IBISWorld founder Mr. Phil Ruthann. Under the supervision of Drs. Chiu and Westveld, Ms. Kuh will statistically consider indicators of socio-economic health and causal modelling. See the ANU write-up.

title: Swen Kuh Approved for Doctor of Philosophy in Statistics
text: Ms. Swen Kuh (now Dr. Kuh) was notified that she has been approved for the award of the degree of Doctor of Philosophy in Statistics from the Research School of Finance, Actuarial Studies and Statistics at the Australian National University. She is currently a post-doctoral fellow at Monash University.

title: ANU Students I am Working with that are Presenting at the JSM 2018
text:
I have three students presenting at the Joint Statistical Meeting (2018) in Vancouver:

Mark Dawkins,Honours student (co-authors: Drs. Grace Chiu and Anton Westveld): Melded Bayesian Inference for Stochastic Theoretical Models with Applications in Agent Based Modeling

Monday, July 30, Speed Session (5 min oral presentation, then poster presentation).

Sessions 166 & link261





Swen Kuh,PhD student (co-authors: Drs. Grace Chiu and Anton Westveld): Model-Based Socio-Economic Health Measures Using Causal Modeling

Wednesday, August 1, Speed Session (5 min oral presentation, then poster presentation)

Sessions link476 & link539





Jaron Lee,Honours student (co-author: Dr. Anton Westveld): A Variational Bayes Approach to Clustered Latent Preference Models for Directed Network Data

Wednesday, August 1, Speed Session (5 min oral presentation, then poster presentation)

Sessions link478 & link540

title: Jiali Wang Approved for Doctor of Philosophy in Statistics
text: Ms. Jiali Wang (now Dr. Wang) was notified that she has been approved for the award of the degree of Doctor of Philosophy in Statistics from the Research School of Finance, Actuarial Studies and Statistics at the Australian National University (thesis). She is currently a post-doctoral fellow at CSIRO’s Data61.

title: Anton Westveld - Inaugural International Partner of Ireland’s Foundations of Data Science for Industry and Enterprise
text:
The application “Centre for Research Training (CRT): Foundations of Data Science for Industry and Enterprise – FUSE”  led by Professor James Gleeson – University of Limerick, Professor Claire Gormley – University College Dublin and Professor Ken Duffy – Maynooth University was successful.
Dr. Anton Westveld and Associate Professor Grace Chiu are very excited to be inaugural international partners in the Centre, which seeks to provide cutting edge training in Data Science (http://www.data-science.ie).

title: Jiali Wang Received the Chris Heyde Scholarship
text: Ms. Jiali Wang, a Ph.D. student that I am co-supervising (along with Dr. Bronwyn Loong and Professor Alan Welsh) has received the linkChris Heyde Scholarship, based on her educational achievement and current track of research.

title: Santiago Marin Won a Best Poster Award at Bayes on the Beach 2024
text: Mr. Marin won a best poster award for his presentation on BOB: Bayesian Optimized Bootstrap with Applications to Gaussian Mixture Models at Bayes on the Beach 2024

title: Jaron Lee Recieved an ANU University Medal - 2016
text: Mr. Jaron Lee, an honours student in statistics, supervised by myself and Professor Simon Jackman (University of Sydney) received an linkANU University Medal based on his thesis and overall undergraduate performance. His thesis was titled linkA Variational Bayes Approach to Clustered Latent Preference Models for Directed Network Data.

title: ASA DataFest 2021 @ The Australian National University
text:
ANU through the Research School of Finance, Actuarial Studies and Statistics (virtually) ran its first ever DataFest competition from April 12- April 14. During the 48-hour friendly competition, seven teams consisting of a total of 26 participants wrangled with and analysed complex data sets on drug use and misuse based on surveys conducted by the Rocky Mountain Poison and Drug Safety Center in four different countries: Canada, Germany, United Kingdom, and United States. Three Statistics Faculty judged the submitted entries, leading to the following awards:

Best Insight: Team Death by Excel

Isha Singhal, Kehan Zhao, Jenney Chen, Benedict Chin, Xinyi (Kayla) Li

Best Visualization: Team FSG

Zixuan Tan, Xinxin Li, Jinghong Pan, Muyao Chen, Chenxin Zhang

Best Use of Outside Data: Team LF Analytics

Sung Jae Lee, Matthew Fisher


We congratulate the winning teams and all the participants. The judges were impressed with the submissions.
The participants had the following to say about the event:

“First experience of handling a very huge data set, great teammates and great overall experience.” - First Year Statistics Major
“The topic is related to real-life problems and the organization is pretty good that I feel that even if we hold the DataFest remotely, we are closely linked with each other.” - Bachelor of Advanced Computing (R&D) (Hons) / Actuarial Studies
“Being able to apply coursework to real data and working with larger data sets.” - Bachelor of Science (Statistics Major, Computer Science Minor)

title: Swen Kuh has Accepted a Research Fellowship (Level B) at Monash University, Melbourne
text: Congratulations to Ms. Kuh who will join the faculty of the Department of Econometrics and Business Statistics at Monash University, Melbourne. She will be a Research Fellow (Level B) working with Dr. Lauren Kennedyon a US NIH Funded Grant in the area of statistical causality in collaboration with Professor Andrew Gelman and Associate Professor Qixuan Chen.
